BBEX3.M.CDF.USD.CA.AC.A01: Exchange rates for the US dollar in the Democratic Republic of the Congo * / USD 1 = CDF ... (middle)
General: * Referred to as indicative rates until December 2008. On 30 June 1998, the Congo franc was introduced as legal tender at a rate of 100,000 new zaires (ZRN) = 1 Congo franc (CDF).

Source: Since January 2009 calculated on the basis of buying and selling rates of the Banque Centrale du Congo, Kinshasa. September 2006 - December 2008 Fortis Bank, Brüssel June 1998 - August 2006 Banque Commerciale du Congo, Kinshasa, and Banque Belgolaise, Brüssel
Comment on 1999-04: On 6 April 1999, the Congo franc was devalued by 36.0 %.
Comment on 2000-01: On 22 January 2000, the Congo franc was devalued by 48.8%.

Comment on 2000-06: On 10 June 2000, the exchange rate was changed to USD 1 = CDF 23.50; calculated devaluation: 61.7%. On 14 June 2000, the exchange rate was set at USD 1 = CDF 24.7369, but was then revised in July 2000.
Comment on 2000-10: On 24 October 2000, the Congo franc was devalued by 53.0%.

Comment on 2001-05: On 28 May 2001, the Congo franc was devalued sharply and the exchange rates were allowed to float freely. Calculated using the exchange rates from 25 May (USD 1 = CDF 50.00) and 28 May (USD 1 = CDF 310.00), the Congo franc was devalued by 83.9%.
Comment on 2009-08: Exchange rate as of 7 September 2009.
